parse.title: Zemouregal & Vorkath
parse.text:
This article is about the boss encounter. For other uses, see Zemouregal & Vorkath (disambiguation).
This article has a strategy guide.
All information on mechanics, setups, and tactics is on the subpage.

Zemouregal & Vorkath is a boss encounter consisting of two primary enemies, Zemouregal and Vorkath. To access this encounter, the players must progress through the quest Battle of Forinthry. During the quest, the players are required to finish the story mode of this encounter. Completion of the quest unlocks the normal mode and hard mode encounters. Players can interact with the commemorative statue in the Town Hall in Fort Forinthry to join a boss instance or claim loot from the encounter.

The pair are primarily known for their materials to create various ranged armours; undead dragonhide armour, tier 75 tank ranged armour made from undead dragon leather, which can be upgraded into dracolich armour via Vorkath's spikes, turning them into tier 90 ranged power armour with a special effect when using bows. The armour can be further upgraded into tier 92 elite dracolich armour in the same manner as elite sirenic armour, or via Vorkath's scale. Another reward is the Lord of Bones codex.

Completing the boss collection log for Zemouregal & Vorkath completes the feat Wall gets knocked down, I'll build it up again and awards the title, [Name] the Walled Guardian.

Mechanics[edit | edit source]

Main article: /Strategies

Players may participate in the encounter alone or with a group of up to 10 players. The encounter is instanced and takes place outside Fort Forinthry.

Enemies in the encounter will have their health scaled to the amount of players present in the arena at a 1:1 ratio. The only exception are Zemouregal's minions; e.g if a group of 8 enters the instance but only 2 players are remaining when he summons a new batch, they will be scaled to duo size.

Siege phase[edit | edit source]

In this stage, players will face hordes of the undead monsters advancing on the walls of Fort Forinthry.

  • In story mode, it is mandatory to disrupt all the places of power with the help of the Raptor to remove all special attacks from the subsequent boss fight.
  • In normal mode, players may choose to disrupt the places of power, with the western one being mandatory to start the boss encounter, though the other two can be optionally cleared to remove some of Zemouregal's special attacks. Unlike Story mode, the Raptor will not assist in either phase.
  • In hard mode, this phase is skipped, with players being taken straight to the boss arena once going past the fort gates.

Boss phase[edit | edit source]

Players will face both Zemouregal and Vorkath together.

  • In story mode, Zemouregal will not have any special attacks as all the places of power are disrupted. The Raptor will also assist.
  • In normal mode, Zemouregal may summon undead minions and/or conjure bone spikes depending on which places of power were disrupted. The Raptor will not assist in the fight.
  • In hard mode, Zemouregal will have full access to all of his special attacks (as the siege phase is completely skipped) and the health of all enemies are doubled.

The encounter ends once Zemouregal reaches 0 health, regardless if Vorkath is present in the arena or not. However, he has a damage-mitigating barrier while Vorkath is present; this is full immunity during phase 1, or around 90% reduction afterwards, thus players are generally required to defeat Vorkath first.

Rewards[edit | edit source]

Finishing the story mode, normal mode, and hard mode of encounters rewards the players with a loot chest corresponding to the encounter difficulty. This chest can either be claimed from Guard captain Sofía who appears in the arena once the encounter ends (running to the tile where Zemouregal died), or claimed from the commemorative statue in the Town Hall.

All players who dealt damage to Zemouregal and Vorkath will be eligible for a chest, as long as they were in the pre-staging area for the instance before entering. This also includes the player dying and coming back during the fight. If a player joins in the fight after the pre-staging area was passed, they will not be eligible for a chest.

The luck effect is applied when a player opens the loot chest, and not when the fight is finished.[1] The story mode loot cannot contain unique items.

Item Quantity Rarity GE price High Alch
Zemouregal & Vorkath loot (story)1Always[d 1]Not soldNot alchemisable
Zemouregal & Vorkath loot (normal)1Always[d 2]Not soldNot alchemisable
Zemouregal & Vorkath loot (hard)1Always[d 3]Not soldNot alchemisable
  1. ^ Only dropped by Story mode version.
  2. ^ Only dropped by Normal mode version.
  3. ^ Only dropped by Hard mode version.

Unique rewards[edit | edit source]

Only the unique rewards are listed here.

Undead dragonhide can be obtained from all chests. The normal mode chest provides access to the spikes, codex and cosmetic token, whereas the hard mode chest has improved drop rates for the three and provides access to the scale drop.

Item Quantity Rarity GE price High Alch
Undead dragonhide4–13Varies15,856–51,532264–858
Vorkath's spike4–9Varies16,130,452–36,293,517Not alchemisable
Vorkath's scale1Varies142,654,951Not alchemisable
Invoke Lord of Bones incantation codex1Varies223,332,133750,000

Tertiary rewards[edit | edit source]

These rewards are put in a player's backpack after finishing the encounter.

Normal mode[edit | edit source]

Item Quantity Rarity GE price High Alch
Vorkath Necromancy weapon override token11/5,000[2]22,734,175Not alchemisable
Vorkath's claw11/2,000–10/2,000[d 1]Not soldNot alchemisable
  1. ^ Has a drop rate of 1/2,000 in normal mode, with a threshold of 400.

Hard mode[edit | edit source]

Item Quantity Rarity GE price High Alch
Vorkath Necromancy weapon override token11/2,500[2]22,734,175Not alchemisable
Vorkath's claw11/1,000–10/1,000[d 1]Not soldNot alchemisable
  1. ^ Has a drop rate of 1/1,000 in hard mode, with a threshold of 400.

Additional rewards[edit | edit source]

These rewards are given by Guard captain Sofía or reclaimed from the commemorative statue. Note that two free inventory spaces are required when claiming Zemouregal's nexus. Having only one free inventory space will reward only the loot chest, and the player will need another kill to be eligible to claim the nexus.

Item Quantity Rarity GE price High Alch
Zemouregal's nexus1Always[d 1]Not soldNot alchemisable
  1. ^ Received at 100 kills (normal and hard modes combined).

This article has an associated transcript page.
Click here for the transcript.

Update history[edit | edit source]

This information has been compiled as part of the update history project. Some updates may not be included – see here for how to help out!
  • patch 22 January 2024 (Update):
    • Special minions now despawn when Vorkath leaves the battle.
  • patch 15 January 2024 (Update):
    • Removed a safe spot from Zemouregal's bone spikes attack during the Battle of Forinthry.
    • Zemouregal's voice lines during the Battle of Forinthry have been trimmed down. He will now shout at you less!
    • Slightly tweaked the timing of Vorkath's hovering breath attack so that the animation lines up with the damage hit better.
    • Fixed a crash when both the player and Zemouregal die at the same time.
    • Fixed an issue where Vorkath was no longer treated as the correct priority by the Death Skulls ability after a Skeleton Shielder had been killed.
  • patch 8 January 2024 (Update):
    • A new item, Vorkath's scale, obtained as a rare drop from hard mode Zemouregal and Vorkath, can be used to upgrade Dracolich armour to Elite Dracolich armour 1:1. This acts as an alternative upgrade path to Ancient Scales.
    • Fixed an issue where players could join another player's instance once the bosses were already defeated.
    • Players can now set fastest kill times when fighting Vorkath and Zemouregal in hard mode.
    • Fixed an issue that would cause the phase markers on Vorkath's HP in the Battle of Forinthry fight to display the wrong information.
    • Fixed an issue that would cause the phase indicators in the Zamorak fight to display the incorrect HP and be stacked at one location.
    • Players now have to be present when starting the Zemouregal and Vorkath fight via the gate to be able to claim loot.
    • Killcount achievements for Vorkath and Zemouregal will now be displayed correctly.
    • Fixed the issue that caused clues to drop on the ground when gaining a Vorkath Shard with the Charos' Clue Carrier equipped.
  • patch 11 December 2023 (Update):
    • Reduced the stats of the monsters in the horde phase of the Vorkath and Zemouregal fight in Normal Mode.
    • Vorkath will now be shot down if the ballista fires just as Vorkath starts flying for his special attack.
    • Sofía's animation in the Battle of Forinthry arena has been changed.
    • Fixed various polycolour issues for some NPCs during the horde phase against Zemouregal and Vorkath.
    • Heal hitsplats are now working as intended when Vorkath is on screen and off screen for his big attack.
    • Familiars now only take damage when the player takes damage to the Zonal Ice Attack.
  • patch 4 December 2023 (Update):
    • Vorkath's 'Ice Circle' attack no longer damages dreadnips or Seren spell prisms.
    • Vorkath breath attack has been updated to provide better visual feedback
    • Hard mode achievements have been added for the Zemouregal & Vorkath battle.
    • Insane Final Boss achievement now correctly shows and track hard mode as well as pet requirement
    • Some items obtained from Battle of Forinthry reward chests are now noted.
    • Zemouregal summons spawn location changed to avoid spawning under Vorkath
    • Players now only take damage if they stop in a poison pool, however, if a poison pool spawns on them, they can mitigate damage by running to an empty square, when the pool appears.
      • If crossing a single pool they will only take damage once a player stops in it.
    • Added the Vorkath Necromancy weapon overrides to the Zemouregal and Vorkath encounter's drop table.
    • Defeating Zemouregal & Vorkath updated to reward Christmas wrapping paper.
  • update 20 November 2023 (Update):
    • Added to game.

References[edit | edit source]

  1. ^ Mod Doom. New Quest & Boss: Vorkath, Battle of Forinthry. Reddit. 17 November 2023. (Archived from the original on 20 November 2023.) Mod Doom: "Hi there - to confirm, luck rings will work when you open the casket, so you don't have to worry about switching throwing the ring on at the end of the fight."
  2. ^ a b The RuneScape Team. "Birthday Bonanza & Vorkath Updates- This Week In RuneScape." 8 January 2024. RuneScape News.
